title: Columbia Walked a Tightrope on Its Way to a $200 Million Settlement With Trump
summary: Talks in Washington. An expert on negotiation. A balancing act. The university chose cooperation over litigation, a strategy both pilloried and praised.

title: Did Columbia’s Deal With Trump Save Its Stature or Sacrifice It?
summary: Reactions ranged from fierce criticism to relief after the university reached a settlement over allegations that it failed to stop the harassment of Jewish students.

title: A Contentious Media Merger, and the F.B.I.’s Epstein Scramble
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Ahead of Shutdown Deadline, Democrats Face a Dilemma on Spending
summary: Democrats are leery of supporting Republican spending measures after the White House forced through clawbacks of funding already approved by Congress.

title: Gabbard’s Attacks on Obama Put the Attorney General in a Tough Spot
summary: The director of national intelligence gave the Justice Department little warning before she demanded an investigation.

title: Powell Tells Trump He Was Wrong About Renovation Costs During Fed Visit
summary: President Trump is used to world leaders bowing down to him, and to cabinet members fawning over him. Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, took a different approach.

title: Saving New York’s Midcentury Signs
summary: The New York Sign Museum in Brooklyn preserves the stories of shuttered local businesses.

title: The World Has Too Much Steel, but No One Wants to Stop Making It
summary: A global plunge in prices, led by increased production from China, and U.S. tariffs threaten steel manufacturing, which has long been a symbol of national might.

title: Behind a Maine Coffee Company’s Decision to Raise Prices
summary: Like many companies, Rock City Coffee resisted increasing prices as President Trump’s trade war drove its costs up. Then it ran out of options.

title: Volkswagen Hit Hard by Trump’s Tariffs
summary: The German automaker said that U.S. import duties erased about $1.5 billion from its profit in the first half of the year, and it lowered its forecasts for the full year.

title: Boeing Emerges as a Winner in Trump’s Trade Wars
summary: Countries striking agreements with the United States have pledged to buy more Boeing planes, but it’s not clear whether those orders were the result of President Trump’s tactics.

title: France Will Recognize Palestinian Statehood, Macron Says
summary: The announcement sets France apart from the United States and most of its close allies, and could cause friction with President Trump.

title: Israel and the U.S. Pull Back From Cease-Fire Talks With Hamas
summary: President Trump’s special envoy said that “we will now consider alternative options to bring the hostages home,” though it was not clear that negotiations had halted.

title: Australia Says Gaza Situation Beyond ‘Worst Fears’ as Pressure Mounts on Israel
summary: Some of Israel’s closest allies have stepped up criticism of its restrictions on aid to Gaza, where doctors and aid organizations say people are dying of starvation.

title: Iran Starts New Talks Today Over Its Nuclear Program. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Three European powers began meeting with an Iranian minister to try to reopen negotiations over the limits of its nuclear activities.

title: Hulk Hogan’s Villainous Turn Changed Pro Wrestling
summary: Hulk Hogan cultivated an image as an all-American hero. But one night in 1996, he decided to stick it to his fans, brother.

title: FCC Approves Skydance’s Merger With Paramount
summary: The deal, which came under intense scrutiny by the Trump administration, was hailed by the F.C.C. chief, who welcomed “significant changes” at CBS, a unit of Paramount.

title: Spat Between Thai and Cambodian Leaders Fuels Deadly Border War
summary: A personal feud between two of Southeast Asia’s political titans is inflaming the worst violence on the border in more than a decade.

title: Thousands Flee Deadly Fighting Between Cambodia and Thailand
summary: More than 100,000 people have been displaced in the deadliest conflict between the two nations in 14 years.

title: The Line Trump Crossed by Accusing Obama of Treason
summary: President Trump’s history of intemperate remarks has earned him a perverse kind of immunity; the more outrageous his statement, the faster it is often dismissed.

title: Is Decarbonization Dead?
summary: Trump just shredded America’s most ambitious climate policy. Jane Flegal and Jesse Jenkins discuss what this means for the future of renewable energy in the U.S.

title: The Starvation Spreading in Gaza
summary: Gaza is descending into anarchy.

title: For Late Night, Epstein-Trump Is the Comedy Gift That Keeps On Giving
summary: Josh Johnson said that “not since Tupac Shakur has a dead man dropped so many bangers.”

title: Ken Paxton Claimed Three Houses as His Primary Residence, Records Show
summary: The attorney general of Texas, who is challenging Senator John Cornyn, could have secured favorable mortgage rates, and may have violated the law if he knowingly falsified loan documents.

title: Alina Habba Is Named Acting U.S. Attorney in New Jersey
summary: Ms. Habba’s tenure as interim U.S. attorney was slated to end this week, but the Trump administration’s appointment will allow her to remain the top law enforcement official in the state.

title: She Tended to Patients Across 4 States. But She Wasn’t a Nurse, Police Say.
summary: A woman who the Pennsylvania State Police say worked under multiple aliases faces multiple criminal charges. The authorities still aren’t sure of her real name.

title: The Kakapo, Its Parasites and a Shared Struggle to Escape Extinction
summary: The endangered kakapo is a flightless bird native to New Zealand. Its population is growing, but its parasites have dwindled. Could that spell trouble?
